page.title: 07Rare Birds Seen At Mulben
page.content: There are many birds seen around Mulderie. Three are uncommon for this area. There is the {gold crested wren}the smallest bird in Europe. He can be recognised by his yellow_orange crown,edged with black. A very different bird is the { {capercaillie.}It is very large with a heavy bill and longish neck, broad wings and rounded tail. In fact, the capercaillie looks like a farmyard turkey. It makes a great noise and flapping when taking off. The capercaillie can run very fast. It feeds on plants, berries and connifer needles.The {buzzard }can also be seen here. It feeds on rabbits, young birds, frogs and insects. The buzzard is a good flier. He can soar and glide. He swoops down on his prey.
